result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan Scott Winters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
A restitution hearing will  be scheduled.
**Restitution has been determined ***

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  Pay resitution plus surcharges; the State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.  Hearing to be scheduled.    
May not have contact with the victims family, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.
***Court costs on Ct. 2 are to be collected during probation.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Atty. Denise Hertz McGrath appeared on behalf of the DE who was previously excused by the court.  The court will allow Ct. 1 to be reinstated in the amended information.  Clerk D. Smith.
to Reinstate Count 1 to the Amended Information, filed with Affidavit of ADA Emily Trigg.  (Hearing 3/6/17 at 2:00.  Def. is excused from attending the hearing, per Judge.)

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Amended Information filed by the State.  Parties stipulate to dismissal of Count 1, based on the Court's definition of an intoxicant as alcohol.   Count 2 in the Amended Information is changed by the Court to Count 1.  Count 3 is changed to Count 2.  Count 4 is changed to Count 3.  State to file a 2nd Amended Information properly designating the counts numerically.  Plea of not guilty entered to the Amended Information as modified.  Bond continued.

Per Atty Hertz-McGrath, defense witness is unavailable for the jury trial the week of 7/17/17.  No objection to an adjournment by ADA Emily Trigg.  Per Judge Bastianelli, FPT on 7/7/17 at 11:00 is changed to 7/28/17 at 11:00.  JS on 7/17/17 at 8:30 is changed to 8/7/17 at 8:30 - #1 case.  Counsel notified in person of change of dates.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defense motions in limine heard and ruled on by the Court.  Court addresses bond due to report received from KSD on 1/17/17 re ELM monitoring.  Atty Hertz-McGrath offers an explanation as to defendant's conduct.  Court continues bond as set.  State has a toxicology expert and Atty Hertz-McGrath will be hiring one if approved by Public Defender's office.  Court sets JS for 7/17/17 at 8:30 (#1 case) and a FPT on 7/7/17 at 11:00.  State will be filing an Amended Information.  Hearing/arraignment on Amended Information set for 2/23/17 at 11:30.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defense motion to modify bond argued.  Court grants modification of bond to $7,000.00 cash with same conditions plus added conditions that def. must be on electronic leg monitor 24 hours a day and must live with his parents, Lori and Jeffrey Winters.  FPT 1/21/16 at 10:00.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: PT
Arguments heard on Atty Hertz-McGrath's motion to compel discovery.  Atty Hertz-McGrath states she received 112 pages from the State late yesterday which may satisfy Exhibit A in her motion in regards to the toxicology file, but needs to review to make sure she received all the discovery in Exhibit A.  Court holds Exhibit A motion in abeyance at this time.  State shall obtain and provide all raw data & reports from the accident scene as requested in Exhibit B of the motion by 11/20/15 and this will be part of the scheduling order.  Atty Hertz McGrath states she will need to have her expert review the discovery from the accident scene.  State shall obtain and provide the autopsy record of the dependent as requested in Exhibit C of the motion by 12/4/15.  DE's motion to modify bond at this time is denied by the court.   Atty Hertz-McGrath may file a new bond motion if DE is able to post a substantial amount and be placed on an electronic leg monitor at which time court may reconsider.  Atty Hertz McGrtath states she will look in to an ELM with the KSD.  December hearing is canceled to allow additional time for discovery.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Atty Hertz McGrath appeared in Branch 8 and court granted request to move motion hearing date.  Motions moved up to 10/27/15 at 10:00 AM and Atty Hertz McGrath to provide notice to all parties.
